intro: Nototriche congesta, commonly known as the clustered nototriche, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its dense clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often covered in fine, white hairs. Nototriche congesta is typically found in dry, open habitats and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
